newsitem.title: POLAND: POLISH INSURER PZU TO UP REAL ESTATE INVESTMENT.
newsitem.headline: POLISH INSURER PZU TO UP REAL ESTATE INVESTMENT.

text.p: Polish insurer Powwzechny Zaklad Ubezpieczen SA (PZU), slated for a partial sell-off this year, wants to increase investment in real estate and build a $100 million business centre in Warsaw, the firm said on Thursday.

"Together with an investor we will soon chose, we want to build a business centre in central Warsaw. I estimate its cost at $100 million," Wieslaw Kietlinski, president of PZU's subsidiary PZU Development Sp. z o.o., told a news conference.
PZU president Jan Monkiewski said the mother company might extend a loan for the project or help find financing from another source.
He added that PZU would increase investment in real estate because it brought high return. Last year the company invested 1.5 billion zlotys, 6.4 percent of which went to real estate.
